page.title: 12Grand Union Canal
page.content: the canal was built about 180 years ago to carry goods to and from London and the Midlands. However with the growth of road and rail transport this use has largely died out and the canal is now given over to a variety of leisure activities. During the summer many people hire converted narrow boats for cruising holidays. We spoke to a family on one of these boats and they had travelled down from Runcorn on the River Mersey on their boat. There is beside the canal a small boatyard that converts boats into pleasure cruisers. Fishing is very popular and a yearly ticket is issued by the London Angling Society for parts of the canal. In addition old gravel workings by the canal have been flooded to make lakes owned by local fishing clubs. People also enjoy just walking on the towpath.
